lines.text: What is that you're reading? Show me.
It's the new E. M. Forster novel.
Oh! Not another of them! Is it amusing?
Why, I find it difficult to identify with the characters, but the locations are quite enchanting.
I'm a beautiful, young virgin in Italy. I want my sexual awakening and I want it now!
Who are you?
My name's George.
George... you have a ripping set of unmentionables!
Time to spread the British Empire.
Where will you go?
My nanna has kindly invited me to London town to stay with her and be a prostitute.
You are indeed fortunate to have such an understanding family.
If you're ever passin', do pop in. Like her and me Mam and me sister, I hope to bear many illegitimate children into abject poverty.

[to George after he saves her from drowning in the lake]
In fact, Cedric saved my life by shouting so bravely.
The bushiness of his eyebrows is more than twice the socially acceptable level.
What did he say?
No, I want... I want to pierce, or otherwise penetrate, her.
Italy is so foreign, look at the effect it's had on poor Mr. Tweeb. I propose we go somewhere more English. The lawn please, George.
India.
I suggest you hide these feelings... in a closet.

[Seeing George wait at the table]
Good grateful, he's white!
Aye, that's right. I'm white. So what? All men are equal, and all women. The world is a changing place.
I won't have an English servant in my house. Bad for the morale. It may cause the whole empire to crumble.
I have my rights.
Rights? This is not some namby-pamby suburb of London, this is the Raj!
Do you make an effort to be stupid or does it come naturally?
Are those the only two choices?
I want the hand of your niece.
Emily must make her own decision.
So you wouldn't object?
I don't give a monkey's.
Miss Ivory, having carefully considered the advantages and disadvantages, I feel it is my duty to ask you to become my wife so that no man may say a Trilling child might be a bastard.
Let it be recorded that the condemned pleaded not guilty.
Ten years, plus two for having pleaded not guilty, making thirteen years in all.
I hate saying goodbye.
Au revoir.
Ciao.
Shalom.
Salam alaikum.
Dear dear George, I'm betrothed to poor poor Cedric... No. Poor poor George, I'm betrothed to dear dear Cedric... No. Poor dear George, I'm betrothed to dear poor...
I wish that Cedric was more like you. He is such a queer fellow and you're always... so gay.
Oh aunt Agnes, just remember you are not losing a niece, you are gaining a man who is... awfully good at croquet and who can probably greet the wedding guests in Greek, Latin... and hieroglyphics.
[Last lines]
Let's get on with it, vicar. I'm going into labour.
